@y0ast
torch.norm() simply computes rowwise vector norm. What I mean here is the matrix norm. See https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy/reference/generated/numpy.linalg.norm.html for some examples. Some are straightforward to implement, but l2-norm, which is fairly important in my field (statistics) requires efficient computation of largest singular value by the power iteration.

@y0ast 
`torch.norm()` simply computes rowwise vector norm. What I mean here is the matrix norm. See https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy/reference/generated/numpy.linalg.norm.html for some examples. Some are straightforward to implement, but l2-norm, which is fairly important in my field (statistics) requires efficient computation of largest singular value by the [power iteration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_iteration).
